metadata.rationale: Extracted from canonical script and scene co-occurrence data.

data.description: Joaquin is a chubby, short, half-bald man in his 50s with a burnt hair comb-over. His mother is a Newfoundlander, and he frequently adopts a Newfoundland accent when cracking jokes, which is most of the time. He is one of three senior interviewers/partners at BEL Inc., affluently dressed and commanding in the office. He is boisterous, crude, sexually inappropriate, and relentlessly humorous in social settings, but reveals a darker, more threatening and volatile side when under the influence of cocaine.
data.dialogue_summary: Joaquin's dialogue is relentlessly loud, crude, and joke-driven, frequently deploying his Newfoundland accent for comedic effect. He uses vulgar nicknames, sexual innuendo, and physical humor to dominate social situations. In professional settings he is terse and pointed. His most revealing dialogue occurs in the washroom, where cocaine strips away his comedic persona and exposes a coercive, racist, and sexually threatening man who attempts to leverage Dante's vulnerability for personal gain. After being physically subdued by Dante, he resorts to calling her a 'bitch' and then publicly ejects her from the bar.

explicit_evidence.quote: You havin' a seizure? You wanna borrow Cassandra's ball gag so you don't swallow your tongue?
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. BEL INC. OFFICE, WINTER, 1997 - JUST BEFORE DAWN

explicit_evidence.quote: It's NEWFOUNDLANDER to you, my son...
explicit_evidence.trait: Newfoundland accent used for comedic effect

explicit_evidence.quote: 3 pairs of Valentino custom made. Have 'em here by next week. And don't you dare send me that ass hide you tried selling me last week.
Holy shit! Ma? Ma? Is that you, MA? He is nose deep into her cleavage and is grabbing at her breasts.
ENOUGH'S ENOUGH. I'M GIVING you 3 choices: you either tell me Abe's secret, I fire you... or (beat) you blow me. Right now, Spic.

explicit_evidence.trait: Uses racial slurs when threatened or intoxicated

inferred_traits.rationale: Joaquin consistently controls the energy of the room through jokes, physical gestures, and loud commands. Others laugh along and defer to him, suggesting he occupies a high-status social role within the group.
inferred_traits.value: High — uses humor and vulgarity to assert dominance in group settings

inferred_traits.rationale: He carries multiple baggies of cocaine and a personal brass locket with a brass straw, suggesting regular, prepared use rather than occasional indulgence. His personality shifts dramatically after use.

His transformation in the washroom — from jovial entertainer to sexually coercive and racially abusive — reveals that his humor is a social mask. The threat he issues to Dante is explicit and predatory.
He notices Dante is unwell and ushers her to the washroom, ostensibly to help her, but then uses her vulnerable state to coerce her. This suggests a manipulative pseudo-paternal dynamic.
He orders Louis XIII cognac shots ($10,000/bottle), carries a thick money clip of hundreds, orders custom Valentino shoes, and sits as one of three senior interviewers at BEL Inc.
inferred_traits.value: Very wealthy, high-ranking at BEL Inc.

data.name: JOAQUIN

relationships.evidence: Joaquin is one of Dante's interviewers, later attempts to sexually coerce her in the washroom, and ultimately ejects her from the bar after she physically resists him.
Abe raises a single finger to silence Joaquin during the interview and Joaquin complies, indicating Abe holds higher authority.
Joaquin jokes about Cassandra's 'ball gag' in the interview, suggesting a long-standing, irreverent familiarity between them.
Kensington tells him 'Fuck you, Joaquin' and he is impressed and amused, suggesting a well-established dynamic of mutual sass.
He buries his face in her cleavage and grabs her breasts upon her arrival, which she rebuffs with 'Screw you, Joaquin,' indicating a pattern of unwanted behavior she tolerates.
